title: 'That is not our problem': What Trump said about global warming, climate change
content: Donald Trump has dismissed concerns about climate change, stating that rising sea levels are not a pressing issue and emphasising 'nuclear warming' as a real threat. His stance contrasts sharply with current administration policies and could lead to significant changes if he wins the upcoming presidential elections.
summary: Donald Trump has dismissed concerns about climate change, stating that rising sea levels are not a pressing issue and emphasising 'nuclear warming' as a real threat. His stance contrasts sharply with current administration policies and could lead to significant changes if he wins the upcoming presidential elections.

title: Trump announces intent to appoint Elon Musk as chief of new efficiency commission if he becomes US president
content: Donald Trump proposes a government efficiency commission led by Elon Musk to audit federal operations and eliminate waste. The initiative aims to save trillions of dollars and improve service quality. Reactions are mixed, with supporters praising Musk's leadership while critics warn it could undermine civil services.
summary: Donald Trump proposes a government efficiency commission led by Elon Musk to audit federal operations and eliminate waste. The initiative aims to save trillions of dollars and improve service quality. Reactions are mixed, with supporters praising Musk's leadership while critics warn it could undermine civil services.

title: Blinken presses Israel, Hamas on truce, says '90 percent agreed'
content: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken on Thursday urged both Israel and Hamas to finalize a Gaza truce, standing by US assessments that 90 percent of a deal was ready. Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu in an interview with Fox News on Thursday denied a US official's assessment that 90 percent of a deal was ready, saying "it's not close."
summary: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken on Thursday urged both Israel and Hamas to finalize a Gaza truce, standing by US assessments that 90 percent of a deal was ready. Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu in an interview with Fox News on Thursday denied a US official's assessment that 90 percent of a deal was ready, saying "it's not close."

title: 'Misguided approach': Telegram CEO Pavel Durov issues first statement after arrest
content: Telegram CEO Pavel Durov addressed his recent arrest in France, calling the charges misguided. He criticized using outdated laws to hold him accountable for third-party actions on Telegram. Durov emphasized Telegram's commitment to content moderation and cooperation with regulators, rejecting claims that the platform is a haven for criminal activities.
summary: Telegram CEO Pavel Durov addressed his recent arrest in France, calling the charges misguided. He criticized using outdated laws to hold him accountable for third-party actions on Telegram. Durov emphasized Telegram's commitment to content moderation and cooperation with regulators, rejecting claims that the platform is a haven for criminal activities.

title: Joe Biden's son Hunter Biden pleads guilty to nine federal tax charges: All you need to know
content: Hunter Biden, son of President Joe Biden, has admitted guilt to nine federal tax charges concerning $1.4 million in unpaid taxes. These include three felonies and six misdemeanors. Sentencing is scheduled for December 16. This trial follows an earlier one this year where he was convicted on firearm-related charges.
summary: Hunter Biden, son of President Joe Biden, has admitted guilt to nine federal tax charges concerning $1.4 million in unpaid taxes. These include three felonies and six misdemeanors. Sentencing is scheduled for December 16. This trial follows an earlier one this year where he was convicted on firearm-related charges.

title: Georgia school shooting: 'Colt Gray received gun used in Apalachee high massacre as Christmas gift from father Colin' - What we know so far
content: Colin Gray was arrested after his son, Colt Gray, committed a deadly shooting at Apalachee High School with an AR-15-style rifle gifted by his father. The incident resulted in four deaths and nine injuries. Earlier investigations into Colt's online threats found insufficient evidence to take action at the time.
summary: Colin Gray was arrested after his son, Colt Gray, committed a deadly shooting at Apalachee High School with an AR-15-style rifle gifted by his father. The incident resulted in four deaths and nine injuries. Earlier investigations into Colt's online threats found insufficient evidence to take action at the time.

title: Georgia school shooting: Father arrested after son obtains rifle used in deadly Apalachee high attack
content: Colin Gray, father of 14-year-old Colt Gray, has been arrested following a tragic school shooting at Apalachee High School that left four dead and nine injured. Investigators suspect that the AR-15-style rifle used in the attack was purchased by Colin as a Christmas gift for his son, raising questions about firearm access.
summary: Colin Gray, father of 14-year-old Colt Gray, has been arrested following a tragic school shooting at Apalachee High School that left four dead and nine injured. Investigators suspect that the AR-15-style rifle used in the attack was purchased by Colin as a Christmas gift for his son, raising questions about firearm access.

title: Teen charged with murder of British Indian, 80, at Leicester park
content: A 14-year-old boy faces charges for the murder of Bhim Kohli, an 80-year-old British Indian man attacked while walking his dog in Leicester. Kohli died from neck injuries sustained during the assault. Three girls and another boy were also arrested but subsequently released without further police action.
summary: A 14-year-old boy faces charges for the murder of Bhim Kohli, an 80-year-old British Indian man attacked while walking his dog in Leicester. Kohli died from neck injuries sustained during the assault. Three girls and another boy were also arrested but subsequently released without further police action.

title: Mind Games: Putin says he prefers Harris as President as Dems say Moscow manipulating MAGA
content: The US Justice Department has charged two Russian media executives with laundering $10 million to fund pro-Moscow propaganda videos distributed by a Tennessee-based company. These videos, which have amassed millions of views, aim to create social divisions in the US and blame Ukraine for the ongoing war with Russia. Moscow dismissed these allegations as nonsense.
summary: The US Justice Department has charged two Russian media executives with laundering $10 million to fund pro-Moscow propaganda videos distributed by a Tennessee-based company. These videos, which have amassed millions of views, aim to create social divisions in the US and blame Ukraine for the ongoing war with Russia. Moscow dismissed these allegations as nonsense.

title: Watch: Indian-origin man in Canada arrested after driving stolen SUV over police cars
content: Ramanpreet Singh, a 25-year-old man from Brampton, has been charged after allegedly attempting to run over Peel police vehicles in Mississauga on September 3, 2024. Officers were trying to apprehend him while he was driving a stolen Ford Bronco SUV. Singh faces multiple charges and is currently in custody awaiting a bail hearing.
summary: Ramanpreet Singh, a 25-year-old man from Brampton, has been charged after allegedly attempting to run over Peel police vehicles in Mississauga on September 3, 2024. Officers were trying to apprehend him while he was driving a stolen Ford Bronco SUV. Singh faces multiple charges and is currently in custody awaiting a bail hearing.

title: Harvey Weinstein indecent assault charges dropped in UK. Here's why
content: British prosecutors have dropped indecent assault charges against Harvey Weinstein, citing no realistic chance of conviction for the alleged 1996 incident in London. Weinstein is already serving a 23-year sentence for rape in the US and has been convicted of another rape case in Los Angeles, resulting in a 16-year sentence.
summary: British prosecutors have dropped indecent assault charges against Harvey Weinstein, citing no realistic chance of conviction for the alleged 1996 incident in London. Weinstein is already serving a 23-year sentence for rape in the US and has been convicted of another rape case in Los Angeles, resulting in a 16-year sentence.

title: 'Don’t know if I'll ever ... ': French woman testifies against husband accused of inviting men to rape
content: Gisèle Pélicot, a 70-year-old French woman, testified against her ex-husband Dominique Pélicot and 50 other men charged with raping her over a decade. She was allegedly drugged and raped while unconscious, with the acts filmed. Police uncovered thousands of disturbing photos and videos during a two-year investigation involving 72 suspects.
summary: Gisèle Pélicot, a 70-year-old French woman, testified against her ex-husband Dominique Pélicot and 50 other men charged with raping her over a decade. She was allegedly drugged and raped while unconscious, with the acts filmed. Police uncovered thousands of disturbing photos and videos during a two-year investigation involving 72 suspects.

title: Fantasy meets reality: Why Chinese women are hiring female cosplayers to play dream men
content: In China, 'cos commissioning' is a growing trend where female cosplayers transform into male video game characters and go on dates with their female fans. This practice allows women to design idealized relationships, blending virtual fantasy with reality. It offers emotional satisfaction and challenges traditional dating norms by providing controlled romantic experiences.
summary: In China, 'cos commissioning' is a growing trend where female cosplayers transform into male video game characters and go on dates with their female fans. This practice allows women to design idealized relationships, blending virtual fantasy with reality. It offers emotional satisfaction and challenges traditional dating norms by providing controlled romantic experiences.

title: US elections: Russian President Putin 'supports' Kamala Harris
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin expressed support for Kamala Harris in the upcoming US presidential election during Russia's Eastern Economic Forum. His remarks appeared sarcastic, responding to US accusations of Russian interference. Putin criticized past sanctions by former President Trump and stressed respecting the choice of American voters while noting Harris's contagious laughter.
summary: Russian President Vladimir Putin expressed support for Kamala Harris in the upcoming US presidential election during Russia's Eastern Economic Forum. His remarks appeared sarcastic, responding to US accusations of Russian interference. Putin criticized past sanctions by former President Trump and stressed respecting the choice of American voters while noting Harris's contagious laughter.

title: South Korea records highest average temperature
content: South Korea's average summer temperature hit a record high of 25.6 degrees Celsius, marking the hottest since nationwide observation began in 1973. The country also faced an unprecedented number of tropical nights. Climate change is identified as the cause, leading to a court ruling mandating revised climate goals.
summary: South Korea's average summer temperature hit a record high of 25.6 degrees Celsius, marking the hottest since nationwide observation began in 1973. The country also faced an unprecedented number of tropical nights. Climate change is identified as the cause, leading to a court ruling mandating revised climate goals.

title: Did Apalachee high school receive shooting threat before mass attack? Georgia official clarify
content: A tragic shooting at Apalachee High School in Winder, Georgia, resulted in four deaths and nine injuries. Initial reports of a warning about the attack were debunked by authorities. The investigation is ongoing to determine how 14-year-old Colt Gray obtained and brought an AR-15 rifle into the school.
summary: A tragic shooting at Apalachee High School in Winder, Georgia, resulted in four deaths and nine injuries. Initial reports of a warning about the attack were debunked by authorities. The investigation is ongoing to determine how 14-year-old Colt Gray obtained and brought an AR-15 rifle into the school.

title: Apalachee high school tragedy: Georgia shooting claims lives of two students and two teachers — who were the victims?
content: A shooting at Apalachee High School in Georgia left two students and two teachers dead. Victims included Mason Schermerhorn, Christian Angulo, Richard Aspinwall, and Christina Irimie. Suspect Colt Gray was apprehended shortly after the incident. Nine others were injured but are expected to recover. Authorities are investigating the motive behind the attack.
summary: A shooting at Apalachee High School in Georgia left two students and two teachers dead. Victims included Mason Schermerhorn, Christian Angulo, Richard Aspinwall, and Christina Irimie. Suspect Colt Gray was apprehended shortly after the incident. Nine others were injured but are expected to recover. Authorities are investigating the motive behind the attack.

title: EasyJet flight makes emergency landing after drunk passenger calls captain ‘rubbish', tries to open exit door: Watch video
content: An EasyJet flight from London to Greece was forced to make an emergency landing in Munich due to a disruptive passenger. The intoxicated man attempted to storm the cockpit and open an exit door, leading to chaos on board. He was subdued by the crew and passengers before being removed by German police.
summary: An EasyJet flight from London to Greece was forced to make an emergency landing in Munich due to a disruptive passenger. The intoxicated man attempted to storm the cockpit and open an exit door, leading to chaos on board. He was subdued by the crew and passengers before being removed by German police.

title: 'Entirely baseless, fabricated': China rejects New Zealand's spy report
content: China refuted New Zealand's allegations of foreign interference against its Chinese communities, labeling them as baseless fabrications. The New Zealand Security Intelligence Service expressed ongoing concerns about foreign interference, particularly from China. The Chinese embassy criticized the report for inciting fear and division while underscoring the importance of their bilateral relationship.
summary: China refuted New Zealand's allegations of foreign interference against its Chinese communities, labeling them as baseless fabrications. The New Zealand Security Intelligence Service expressed ongoing concerns about foreign interference, particularly from China. The Chinese embassy criticized the report for inciting fear and division while underscoring the importance of their bilateral relationship.

title: Chinese cities suspend schools, cancel flights ahead of super typhoon Yagi
content: Southern China has suspended schools and flights as tropical storm Yagi turns into a super typhoon heading towards Hainan. The storm has already caused deadly floods in the Philippines. Hong Kong braces for strong winds, while Vietnam readies its military and coastal measures for Yagi's expected impact.
summary: Southern China has suspended schools and flights as tropical storm Yagi turns into a super typhoon heading towards Hainan. The storm has already caused deadly floods in the Philippines. Hong Kong braces for strong winds, while Vietnam readies its military and coastal measures for Yagi's expected impact.
